intro: Psilocaulon inconstrictum, commonly known as the narrow-stemmed psilocaulon, is a species of flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many genera with medicinal and ornamental value. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, clustered leaves. Its flowers are typically white or pale pink, and it produces small, dry fruits. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and less-studied species within its family.
